body: @ajcvickers is this only reproducible for you with HasPostgresArrayConversion? If so, I may need to take a look for the PG-specific side.
@roji No, it appears to be `.HasDefaultValue(Array.Empty<Flag>())` that's causing the issue.
@Razorik As a workaround, use `.HasDefaultValueSql("ARRAY[]::text[]")` instead of the `HasDefaultValue` call.

rename.to: Migrations: Differ doesn't use configured ValueComparer for DefaultValue

body: Looks like we just call Equals to compare the source and target default value objects. We should use the configured ValueComperer instead.

issue.title: Migrations: Use comparer to diff default values

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.
